Description: Tissue Imaging and Molecular Reflection 3D Cancer Imaging 3D imaging has revolutionized pathology practice by enhancing tissue visualization, enabling quantitative analysis of biomarkers, facilitating virtual collaboration, advancing cancer research, and integrating with molecular pathology techniques. These advancements contribute to more accurate diagnosis, personalized treatment strategies, and improved patient outcomes in cancer care. We have adapted the micro-computed tomography (micro-CT) system for scanning of whole tissue samples and formalin-fixed paraffin-embedded (FFPE) blocks alongside whole slide imaging (WSI) to re-construct various 3D models. It can provide valuable additional information for cancer research and diagnosis
Location: Spotlight Theater C - Sails Pavilion - Conv Ctr
